name: Stock Report Generator
initial_requirements: I need a system to help me get stock information and analysis reports.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I assume that when I type either a stock code or a company name, the system will correctly recognize which stock I mean even if there are multiple similar names.
I expect the system to allow me to enter stock codes or names in a single input field rather than forcing me to choose between different input modes.
I expect the system to accept commonly used ticker formats and company name variants without requiring exact, case‑sensitive matches.
I expect the system to support searching and generating reports for multiple stocks within the same session without having to restart the process each time.
I assume that the stock information and analysis in the reports will focus on currently listed and actively traded stocks rather than delisted or illiquid ones.
I expect summarized stock information to show only the most essential data points instead of all available details.
I expect the summarized stock information to highlight key indicators such as current price, recent change, and basic performance metrics rather than narrative analysis.
I assume that the customizable reports will be composed of predefined content sections that I can include or exclude instead of writing free‑form analysis text myself.
I expect basic stock information in the report to cover essential identification and trading details rather than in‑depth technical or macroeconomic analysis.
I expect market trends in the report to be based on historical price and volume data over a recent time window rather than long‑term qualitative industry forecasts.
I expect the financial data in the report to be drawn from officially reported financial statements instead of user‑generated or unofficial sources.
I prefer that reports generated from my inputs always include some minimal core information even if I deselect most optional sections.
I expect to specify my reporting requirements through simple selections and inputs rather than writing complex queries or commands.
I expect that once I have chosen report content and format for a stock, I can reuse or adjust those choices easily for other stocks without starting from scratch.
I expect the process of choosing report content and formats to happen within a guided interface rather than through multiple disconnected pages.
I expect the automatic report generation to be triggered by a clear action, such as a button, after I finish entering stock identifiers and preferences.
I assume that the default report format will be a readable on‑screen layout that does not require downloading files to view the content.
I expect that different report formats will mainly change the layout and level of detail while keeping the underlying information consistent.
I expect the white background and navy components to be applied consistently across all pages and report views for a uniform appearance.
I expect the navy components, such as headings, navigation, and key controls, to stand out clearly against the white background for easy recognition.

URL: As a user, I want to search for stock information by stock codes or names so that I can find the stocks I am interested in.
As a user, I want to view summarized stock information so that I can quickly understand the key details.
As a user, I want to generate customized stock reports based on my requirements so that I can get analysis tailored to my needs.
As a user, I want to input stock codes or names so that the website can generate the corresponding reports.
As a user, I want to select report formats so that I can customize how my stock reports are presented.
As a user, I want to select report content so that I can include only the information that is relevant to me.
As a user, I want the website to automatically generate the corresponding reports so that I can save time and effort.
As a user, I want the reports to include basic stock information so that I can understand the fundamental details of a stock.
As a user, I want the reports to include market trends so that I can analyze how the stock is performing in the market.
As a user, I want the reports to include financial data so that I can make informed investment decisions.
As a user, I want the website to have a white background color so that the interface appears clean and readable.
As a user, I want the website components to be navy in color so that the interface has a consistent visual style.
instruction: Please implement a website for generating stock reports to provide stock information and analysis. The website should have the functionality to search and summarize stock information, and generate customized stock reports based on user requirements. Users should be able to input stock codes or names, select report formats and content, and the website will automatically generate the corresponding reports. The reports should include basic stock information, market trends, financial data, and more. Set the background color to white and the component color to navy.

name: Neighborhood Insights Mapper
initial_requirements: I need a system that helps me compare key characteristics of different neighborhoods.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I want to be able to select and compare multiple neighborhoods or areas within a single session without re-entering my choices each time.
I expect to identify neighborhoods or areas using familiar geographic labels such as city, district, zip code, or named neighborhood boundaries.
I expect the system to support comparison of more than two neighborhoods at once so I can see patterns across several areas simultaneously.
I want the system to provide data at a consistent geographic granularity so that comparisons between areas are directly meaningful.
I assume the system will cover a sufficiently broad range of neighborhoods within the regions I am interested in, rather than just a few sample areas.
I want demographic data to include multiple commonly used population attributes rather than a single demographic indicator.
I want economic data to include several key financial indicators that allow a nuanced understanding of neighborhood economic conditions.
I want crime data to be organized into different types or categories of incidents so that safety levels can be compared more precisely.
I expect the data used for comparisons to be drawn from recent time periods so that neighborhood characteristics reflect current conditions.
I assume that demographic, economic, and crime information will be aligned by the same time frame when shown together to enable proper comparison.
I want to be able to interact with charts through actions such as hovering, clicking, or selecting ranges to reveal more detailed information.
I expect to filter and refine the displayed data by criteria such as time period, neighborhood, or data category without leaving the dashboard view.
I want changes I make to filters or selections to update the relevant charts and comparisons immediately within the dashboard.
I assume that customizing a dashboard layout will be done through direct manipulation actions like dragging, resizing, or rearranging visual components.
I want differences between neighborhoods to be clearly highlighted in the visualizations so that comparisons can be understood at a glance.
I expect charts to use consistent scales and legends when comparing neighborhoods so that visual comparisons are not misleading.
I want the dashboard to present multiple charts on a single screen so I can compare different types of data side by side.
I assume that each chart and panel will be labeled with clear titles and axis descriptions so I can interpret the neighborhood data without ambiguity.
I expect the default dashboard configuration to show a balanced overview of demographic, economic, and crime information before I customize it.

URL: As a user, I want to compare demographic data across different areas so that I can understand how populations differ between neighborhoods.
As a user, I want to compare economic data across different areas so that I can analyze financial conditions in various neighborhoods.
As a user, I want to compare crime data across different areas so that I can evaluate safety levels between neighborhoods.
As a user, I want to use data dashboards with interactive charts so that I can explore neighborhood data visually and in more detail.
As a user, I want customizable dashboard layouts so that I can arrange the charts and information in a way that best fits my needs.
instruction: Please implement a web-based neighborhood mapping application for comparing data across different areas. The application should allow users to compare demographic, economic, and crime data across different areas. The application should also include data dashboards with interactive charts and customizable layouts. Use ivory for the background and forest green for components.

name: Multi-Company Finance Dashboard
initial_requirements: I need a system to help me view and manage financial information across multiple companies in one place.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I assume each company will be uniquely identifiable in the system so that I can clearly distinguish and select companies when viewing or managing their financial data.
I expect to be able to select specific companies or groups of companies as input when generating consolidated reports or cross-company views.
I assume the system will recognize standard financial data elements (such as revenue, expenses, assets, liabilities) from each company as the basis for comparisons and consolidation.
I expect the dashboard to handle more than two companies at once so that multi-company analysis is not limited to pairwise comparisons.
I assume the system will cover both high-level summaries and detailed line-item financial data for each company within the same environment.
I expect the consolidated reports and comparisons to span all companies configured in the system by default, unless I explicitly filter them.
I want the dashboard to include key financial metrics and summaries that are commonly used to assess company performance, rather than only raw transaction data.
I expect consolidated reports to present aggregated financial figures that are already combined across companies, instead of requiring me to manually add up results.
I assume cross-company comparisons will be based on comparable metrics using a consistent currency and time period so that the results are meaningful.
I want company-specific views to include enough detailed information to trace how figures in consolidated reports are derived.
I expect to navigate from the multi-company overview down into individual company details without leaving the dashboard context.
I want to trigger report generation and comparisons directly from the dashboard rather than using a separate tool or application.
I assume I can choose parameters such as date ranges or reporting periods when generating financial reports and comparisons.
I expect the system to support iterative analysis, allowing me to adjust filters or company selections and immediately see updated views or reports.
I want the dashboard to present multi-company data in a layout that clearly separates individual company information from consolidated information.
I assume cross-company comparisons will be visually organized in a way that makes differences and similarities easy to spot, such as aligned tables or side-by-side sections.
I expect consolidated reports to be presented in a structured, readable format similar to traditional financial statements.
I want the mint cream background and teal-styled components to apply consistently across all dashboard screens and report views so that the visual design feels uniform.
I assume the chosen mint cream background and teal components will not interfere with the readability of financial figures and labels on the dashboard.

URL: As a user, I want to view a multi-company dashboard so that I can manage and display financial data from multiple companies.
As a user, I want the dashboard to collect financial information from each company so that all relevant data is available in one place.
As a user, I want the dashboard to display financial information from each company so that I can see each company’s financial status.
As a user, I want the dashboard to provide consolidated reports so that I can see combined financial results across companies.
As a user, I want to perform cross-company comparisons so that I can analyze financial performance between companies.
As a user, I want to perform cross-company reporting so that I can generate reports that span multiple companies.
As a user, I want to browse financial data from each company so that I can review company-specific financial details.
As a user, I want to view consolidated reports so that I can understand overall financial performance across all companies.
As a user, I want to perform financial management using the dashboard so that I can oversee and control financial activities.
As a user, I want to perform financial reporting using the dashboard so that I can generate the financial reports I need.
As a user, I want the dashboard to use mint cream as the background so that the interface has the specified appearance.
As a user, I want all components styled with teal so that the dashboard has a consistent visual theme.
instruction: Please implement a multi-company dashboard for managing and displaying financial data from multiple companies. The dashboard should be able to collect and display financial information from each company, provide consolidated reports, and support cross-company comparisons and reporting. Users should be able to browse financial data from each company, view consolidated reports, and perform financial management and reporting. Apply mint cream as the background; style all components with teal.

name: Basketball Betting Insights
initial_requirements: I need a system to help me analyze basketball information so I can make more informed betting decisions.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I only need the system to cover basketball-related betting information and not other sports.
I expect the system to include both historical and upcoming basketball games to support my betting decisions.
I want team-level, player-level, and match-level data to all be included in the analysis scope.
I expect to be able to select specific teams, players, or matches as the focus of the analysis I am viewing.
I want to be able to specify a particular time range or season when browsing basketball data.
I want the system to present betting-relevant statistics such as scores, win–loss records, and player performance metrics rather than general basketball facts.
I expect match history to include final scores, dates, and participating teams so that past outcomes can be interpreted in a betting context.
I want team rankings to reflect competitive strength based on recent performance rather than only long-term historical records.
I expect player performance information to include recent form and consistency, not just career averages.
I want match predictions to be derived from underlying data and analysis rather than being purely subjective opinions.
I expect betting recommendations to be tied explicitly to available betting options such as moneyline, spread, or totals.
I want to navigate through different types of basketball data, such as match history, team rankings, and player performance, using the same website interface.
I prefer to explore the analysis results interactively rather than only receiving a single static recommendation.
I want to be able to drill down from high-level summaries into more detailed statistics when something in the data catches my attention.
I expect to be able to move back and forth between data views and betting recommendations without losing my place or context.
I prefer data visualizations such as charts or graphs over raw tables when interpreting trends in basketball betting data.
I want visualizations and numeric data for the same information to be shown together so that I can cross-check what I see.
I expect the color scheme with a ghost white background and slate gray components to be applied consistently across all pages and views of the website.
I want the ghost white background and slate gray components to provide sufficient contrast so that betting data and visualizations remain easy to read.
I prefer a layout where match predictions, betting recommendations, and supporting data are visually grouped so I can quickly connect them when making decisions.

URL: As a user, I want to browse data for basketball so that I can access relevant betting information.
As a user, I want to view data visualizations so that I can better understand basketball betting data and analysis.
As a user, I want to see match predictions so that I can anticipate game outcomes.
As a user, I want to get betting recommendations so that I can make more informed betting choices.
As a user, I want to view match history so that I can analyze past game results.
As a user, I want to view team rankings so that I can compare team performance levels.
As a user, I want to view player performance so that I can assess individual players when making betting decisions.
As a user, I want to make informed betting decisions based on the analysis results so that I can improve my chances of successful bets.
As a user, I want the website background to be ghost white so that the interface is visually consistent with the specified design.
As a user, I want the website components to be slate gray so that the visual elements follow the defined color scheme.
instruction: Please implement a sports analytics website that provides basketball betting data and analysis. The website should have functionalities for data visualization, match prediction, and betting recommendations. Users should be able to browse data for basketball, view match history, team rankings, player performance, and make informed betting decisions based on the analysis results. Define the background as ghost white and components as slate gray.

name: Regulatory Policy Dashboard
initial_requirements: I need a system that helps me easily understand and analyze complex regulatory policies.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I expect to identify regulatory policies primarily by attributes such as jurisdiction, sector, topic, and date rather than by internal IDs or technical codes.
I want to be able to select regulatory policies from a list or catalog rather than having to manually input full policy details myself.
I expect the system to cover multiple regulatory policies at once so I can move between them without leaving the analysis environment.
I want to be able to limit my work to a subset of policies that match my interests instead of always seeing the entire set of available regulations.
I expect each regulatory policy entry to include both a human‑readable summary and the original policy text so I can understand details while retaining authoritative wording.
I want the system to include structured metadata for each policy, such as effective dates, responsible authority, and status, to support my analysis.
I expect the related data shown with a policy to include quantitative indicators such as metrics, counts, or historical trends that help explain the policy’s impact or context.
I want the charts and visualizations to be derived from the same underlying policy and contextual data that I am viewing in textual form.
I expect to navigate between the textual policy view and its visualizations through simple interactions such as clicking or tapping within the same interface.
I want to interactively adjust filters and immediately see the list of displayed policies update without needing to reload the page or start a new query.
I expect sorting options to be accessible through simple controls such as dropdowns or column headers that can be changed at any time while browsing.
I want to be able to switch back and forth between different sorting criteria without losing my current filter settings.
I expect to be able to click on a policy from a list or visualization to open a more detailed view of that specific policy and its related data.
I want policy information to be presented in a structured layout where the main policy text, related data, and visualizations are clearly separated but visible together.
I expect data visualizations and charts to use clear labels, legends, and axes so that I can interpret them without needing external explanations.
I want the list of regulatory policies to be presented in a tabular or card‑based format that makes it easy to scan key attributes at a glance.
I expect filters and sorting controls to be displayed close to the list of policies so that their effect on the displayed content is obvious.
I want the system to visually emphasize which filters and sorting options are currently active so I always understand why particular policies are being shown.

URL: As a user, I want to browse different regulatory policies so that I can view relevant policy information.
As a user, I want to analyze different regulatory policies so that I can better understand complex regulations.
As a user, I want to view data visualizations of regulatory policies so that I can clearly see complex policy information.
As a user, I want to view related data alongside the policies so that I can understand the context and details of each policy.
As a user, I want to view charts related to regulatory policies so that I can interpret policy data more easily.
As a user, I want to filter the displayed regulatory policies so that I can focus on the policies that meet my criteria.
As a user, I want to sort the displayed regulatory policies so that I can organize them according to my needs.
instruction: Please implement a dashboard website for displaying regulatory policies. The website should have data visualization capabilities to clearly display complex regulatory policies. Users should be able to browse and analyze different policies, view related data and charts, and be able to filter and sort as needed. Assign lavender to the background and indigo to the UI elements.

name: Solar Monitoring Dashboard
initial_requirements: I need a system that helps me understand and track my solar energy performance over time.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I assume the system will uniquely identify and connect to my specific solar installation as the single data source for all measurements.

I expect the system to automatically obtain real-time values for solar generation, power consumption, and battery level from my existing solar hardware or monitoring gateway without requiring manual data entry.
I want all solar performance metrics in the system to be limited to my own property and not aggregated with data from other users or locations.
I expect historical data to be stored for a sufficiently long period to allow analysis of seasonal and long-term trends, not just a few recent days.
I want both generation and consumption data to be available at the same time intervals so they can be meaningfully compared over time.
I assume historical queries can be limited to user-specified date ranges so that I do not always have to scan the entire data history.
I want real-time solar power generation and consumption data to be displayed using standard power and energy units that I can easily interpret, such as watts and kilowatts.
I expect the battery level to be shown as a percentage value rather than only as raw voltage or other technical metrics.
I want historical trend views to include both solar generation and power consumption within the same analytical context so I can compare them directly.
I expect the charts to display time on one axis and the chosen solar metrics on the other axis so that trends over time are clear.
I assume the system will distinguish between different types of data series in charts, such as generation, consumption, and battery level, so I can tell them apart easily.
I want to be able to select which metric or combination of metrics is shown in a chart so I can focus on the specific aspect of solar performance I am analyzing.
I expect that interacting with charts, such as hovering or tapping, will reveal precise numeric values for specific points in time.
I assume I can switch between real-time views and historical analysis views within the same dashboard without needing a completely separate application.
I want to initiate historical data queries through simple controls such as date pickers or predefined time-range buttons rather than typing complex commands.
I want all primary dashboard screens where solar data is monitored and analyzed to share the same honeydew background color for a consistent look.
I expect key dashboard components such as panels, cards, and chart containers to use dark olive green as their main accent or foreground color to maintain a cohesive theme.
I assume that text and graphical elements will be styled so that the honeydew background and dark olive green components remain legible and visually distinct.
I want the real-time metrics and charts to be presented on a single dashboard view so that I can see the overall solar performance at a glance.

URL: As a user, I want to view real-time solar data so that I can monitor current system performance.
As a user, I want to view real-time solar power generation data so that I can understand how much power is being produced.
As a user, I want to view real-time power consumption data so that I can see how much power is being used.
As a user, I want to view real-time battery percentage so that I can track the current battery level.
As a user, I want to query historical solar data so that I can review past performance.
As a user, I want to view historical data trends so that I can analyze how solar power generation and consumption change over time.
As a user, I want to analyze solar data using charts so that I can visually interpret performance and trends.
As a user, I want the dashboard background color configured to honeydew so that the interface has the specified appearance.
As a user, I want dashboard components to use dark olive green so that the component styling matches the specified theme.
instruction: Please implement a solar dashboard to display real-time and historical solar data. The dashboard should have functionalities for real-time data display, historical data query, and chart analysis. Users should be able to view real-time data such as solar power generation, power consumption, and battery percentage, and query historical data to view trends. Configure the background color to honeydew, with components using dark olive green.

name: Online Texas Hold'em Platform
initial_requirements: I need an online system where people can gather to play Texas Hold'em poker with others.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I expect to identify game rooms in the lobby by a clear room name or label so that I can distinguish between different tables.
I expect to identify myself in the system through a unique player identity, such as a username or display name, that other players can see in game rooms.
I expect to select game rooms and features in the lobby primarily through mouse or touch clicks on visible UI elements rather than through manual text input.
I expect the poker table to visually identify my own seat and cards distinctly from those of other players.
I assume that all poker games in the system follow the standard rules of Texas Hold'em without mixing in other poker variants.
I expect that all interactions related to game rooms, gameplay, chat, records, and account management occur within a single integrated online system.
I assume that a game room is dedicated to a single Texas Hold'em table at a time rather than supporting multiple tables in one room.
I expect that the system supports both newly starting games and games that are already in progress when I browse available rooms.
I expect each game room entry in the lobby to show enough status details, such as whether a game is waiting for players or currently playing, to help me decide whether to join.
I expect the player information shown in the lobby for each room to include at least the number of players and their identifiers so that I know who is at the table.
I expect my player hand cards to be visible only to me and not to other players at the table.
I expect community cards to be visible to all players seated at the table as shared information.
I expect the betting information at the table to include the current pot size and each player’s current bet or contribution in the ongoing hand.
I expect the available action buttons to reflect only the actions that are valid at my current turn, such as betting, calling, raising, checking, or folding.
I expect chat messages to be associated with the specific game room or table where I am currently playing rather than spanning unrelated rooms.
I expect my game records to include at least basic information such as date, game room or table, and outcome so I can meaningfully review my performance.
I expect account management to cover personal profile details and configurable settings relevant to my experience in the poker system.
I expect to interact with the poker system entirely through my web browser without needing to install additional desktop applications.
I expect navigation from the lobby to a selected game room or feature to occur via straightforward clicks on lobby items or menu entries.
I expect joining or creating a game room to result in an immediate transition to the corresponding poker table view where I can start playing.
I expect that when it is my turn to act at the table, the system will clearly indicate my turn and allow me to choose an action using on-screen buttons.
I expect chat input to be entered through a simple text field with a send action so I can communicate in real time during the game.
I expect viewing my game records and managing my account information to be accessible from the main interface without leaving the web application.
I expect the azure page background color to be consistently applied across the main pages of the system, including the lobby and table views.
I expect the midnight blue color to be used consistently for primary UI elements such as buttons, panels, or frames to maintain a coherent visual theme.
I expect the visual layout of the table view to resemble a physical poker table with clearly arranged seats, cards, and betting areas.
I expect player information in the lobby and at the table to be presented in a readable, structured format that makes it easy to see who is in each game.
I expect the lobby to present available game rooms in a list or grid format that allows me to scan multiple rooms and their statuses at a glance.
I expect chat messages to appear in a scrolling conversation view near the table so that I can follow the discussion while watching the game.
I expect key gameplay information such as community cards, my hand, and pot size to be visually emphasized so I can quickly understand the game state.

URL: As a user, I want to access a web-based Texas Hold'em poker game so that I can play through my browser.
As a user, I want to use a game lobby so that I can navigate to different poker game rooms and features.
As a user, I want to see available game rooms in the game lobby so that I can choose a room to join.
As a user, I want to see the current game status of each room in the game lobby so that I can decide which game to join.
As a user, I want to see player information in the game lobby so that I know who is participating in each game room.
As a user, I want to create game rooms so that I can start new Texas Hold'em games with other players.
As a user, I want to join existing game rooms so that I can participate in ongoing or new Texas Hold'em games.
As a user, I want to play Texas Hold'em at the table game so that I can enjoy poker gameplay online.
As a user, I want the table game to display my player hand cards so that I know which cards I have been dealt.
As a user, I want the table game to display community cards so that I can see the shared cards on the table.
As a user, I want the table game to display betting information so that I can understand the current bets and pot size.
As a user, I want the table game to provide action buttons so that I can perform actions such as betting, calling, or folding.
As a user, I want chat functionality so that I can communicate with other players during the game.
As a user, I want to view my game records so that I can review my past games and performance.
As a user, I want to manage my account information so that I can keep my profile and settings up to date.
As a user, I want the page background to use an azure color so that the interface has the specified visual theme.
As a user, I want the UI elements to use a midnight blue color so that the game components visually match the design requirement.
instruction: Please develop a web-based Texas Hold'em poker game with features such as game lobby, table games, and chat functionality. Users should be able to create or join game rooms, play Texas Hold'em, view game records, and manage their account information. The game lobby should display available game rooms, current game status, and player information. The table game should display player hand cards, community cards, betting information, and action buttons. Implement azure for the page background and midnight blue for the elements.

name: Online Trivia Contest App
initial_requirements: I need a system to let people participate in online knowledge competitions and see how they perform compared to others.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I want to identify each contest by a recognizable title and basic descriptive information when browsing.
I expect contests to be distinguishable by attributes such as topic, date, or difficulty when I browse them.
I want to be able to enroll in more than one contest over time, not just a single competition.
I expect each contest to contain multiple questions rather than just a single trivia item.
I assume that rankings and leaderboards are calculated per contest rather than across all contests combined.
I expect contest listings to provide enough information about each contest to decide whether I want to enroll.
I want each trivia question to include all necessary text and options so I can answer without needing external context.
I expect my score display to show the total points or number of correct answers for a contest.
I want ranking information to indicate both my position and the total number of participants in that contest.
I expect the leaderboard to show at least the top performers’ names or identifiers and their scores.
I want to be able to browse contests without being forced to enroll immediately.
I expect the act of enrolling in a contest to be an explicit user action separate from simply viewing contest details.
I want to submit answers through a clear input mechanism for each question, such as selecting an option or entering text.
I expect my answers to be considered for scoring only after I explicitly submit them.
I want to be able to revisit my score and ranking after the contest has ended, not just immediately after submission.
I expect contest browsing, enrollment, answering, and result viewing to be accessible through a unified interface.
I want scores and rankings to be displayed in a visually clear way that allows easy comparison between participants.
I expect beige to be used as the dominant background or base color throughout the app’s screens.
I want saddle brown to be consistently applied to interactive components such as buttons, headers, and key UI elements.
I expect the beige and saddle brown color scheme to be applied uniformly so that no component uses conflicting colors.

URL: As a user, I want to browse contests so that I can find knowledge competitions to participate in.
As a user, I want to enroll in contests so that I can join online trivia competitions.
As a user, I want to view contest questions so that I can read the trivia items during the competition.
As a user, I want to submit my answers so that I can participate in the scoring of the contest.
As a user, I want my answers to be scored so that I can know how well I performed in the trivia contest.
As a user, I want to view my scores so that I can see the results of my participation in the contest.
As a user, I want to view my ranking so that I can understand my position relative to other participants.
As a user, I want to view a leaderboard so that I can compare my performance with others.
As a user, I want the app to use beige as the base color so that the visual theme is consistent.
As a user, I want all components to use saddle brown so that the app’s interface matches the specified color scheme.
instruction: Please implement an online trivia contest app for hosting knowledge competitions. The app should have functionalities for contest enrollment, question display, answer submission, scoring, and leaderboard. Users should be able to browse and enroll in contests, answer contest questions, submit answers, view their scores and rankings, and compare their performance with others on the leaderboard. Specify beige as the base color and saddle brown for all components.

name: Online Chess Platform
initial_requirements: I need a system that lets me play chess online against others or the computer.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I assume the system will support both games against human opponents and games against a computer opponent within the same interface.
I expect to identify a game I want to join from a list of available online games rather than by manually entering technical identifiers.
I want to specify my move by selecting a source square and a destination square on the board instead of typing chess notation.
I prefer to interact with the chessboard primarily through mouse or touch clicks rather than through keyboard commands.
I assume that moves can only be undone in games where both players or the game rules permit undoing, not in every possible situation.
I want the undo action to be triggered via a dedicated control such as an undo button rather than re-entering previous moves.
I assume that resigning ends the current game session immediately and cannot be reversed.
I expect that when I resign, the game result will be recorded as a loss for me and a win for my opponent in any tracked statistics.
I want theme choices to affect the visual style of the board and pieces while keeping the underlying chess rules unchanged.
I prefer to change board themes through simple clickable controls instead of using configuration files or advanced settings screens.
I assume that difficulty levels apply specifically to games against the computer opponent and not to games against human players.
I want to select a difficulty level using clear, discrete options such as labeled buttons rather than entering numeric values.
I expect the game history to show the full sequence of moves from the start of the game up to the current position.
I want the game history to be displayed in a human-readable format such as move pairs listed in order rather than as raw internal data.
I assume that statistics are accumulated across multiple games played over time rather than being limited to a single session.
I expect the statistics to include at least basic performance indicators such as number of games played, wins, losses, or draws.
I want statistics to be presented in a summarized view that allows me to quickly understand my overall performance without detailed analysis tools.
I prefer to access game history and statistics through simple navigational elements such as tabs, buttons, or menu items within the game interface.
I assume each game is treated as a distinct session that can be created, joined, played, and then finished or exited independently of other games.
I expect that game history and statistics will be associated with my user identity so they can be viewed across different game sessions.

URL: As a user, I want to create new games so that I can start playing chess online.
As a user, I want to join existing games so that I can play chess with others who have already started a game.
As a user, I want to move pieces so that I can make my chess moves during the game.
As a user, I want to undo moves so that I can correct mistakes or reconsider my strategy.
As a user, I want to resign from a game so that I can concede when I no longer wish to continue playing.
As a user, I want to click buttons to choose from different board themes so that I can customize the appearance of the chessboard.
As a user, I want to click buttons to choose from different difficulty levels so that I can adjust how challenging the game is.
As a user, I want to view game history so that I can review the moves made during the game.
As a user, I want to view statistics so that I can understand my performance over time.
instruction: Please implement a chess web application where users can play chess online. The application should have functionalities for creating new games, joining existing games, moving pieces, undoing moves, and resigning. Users should be able to click buttons to choose from different board themes and difficulty levels, and view game history and statistics. Style the layout with alice blue in the background and steel blue for the interface.

name: Prize Wheel
initial_requirements: I need a system that lets users participate in a prize-drawing wheel to win rewards.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I assume that my identity on the website is distinguishable from other users so that my winning records can be associated with me personally.
I expect that each spin of the wheel results in a single, clearly determined outcome that either is a specific prize or an explicit indication of not winning.
I expect that every prize shown in the prize list is actually obtainable from spinning the wheel and that there are no hidden prizes beyond those shown.
I want each prize in the prize list to include enough descriptive information, such as a name and a brief description, to understand what I would receive.
I expect my winning records to include key details such as the prize won and the time or date of winning so that I can meaningfully review my past wins.
I assume that non-winning spins do not need to be stored in my winning records, and only successful wins should be recorded.
I prefer to initiate a wheel spin through a clear, single user action such as clicking a button or the wheel itself.
I expect that I can access the prize list and my winning records through straightforward navigation options from within the same website.
I expect that the wheel does not spin automatically without my explicit action, so that I feel in control of when a draw occurs.
I expect the prize list to be presented in a structured, readable format such as a list or grid, rather than being embedded only inside the wheel graphic.
I expect my winning records to be displayed in an ordered list, with the most recent wins easy to spot.
I assume that the light gray background should apply consistently across all pages of the website related to the prize-drawing wheel.
I expect that dark red is used consistently for primary interactive components such as buttons, highlights, or wheel accents to maintain a coherent theme.
I assume that the text and prize information will remain easily readable against the light gray background and dark red component styling.

URL: As a user, I want to spin the wheel so that I can try to win prizes.
As a user, I want the website to provide functionality for spinning the wheel so that I can interact with the wheel of fortune.
As a user, I want to view the prize list so that I can see what prizes are available to win.
As a user, I want to view the displayed prizes so that I can understand the potential rewards.
As a user, I want my winning records to be recorded so that I can keep track of my past wins.
As a user, I want to view my own winning records so that I can review what I have previously won.
As a user, I want the website to use light gray as the default background so that the overall appearance is consistent with the design.
As a user, I want the website to use dark red for component styling so that the interface elements follow the specified theme.
instruction: Please implement a wheel of fortune website where users can spin the wheel to win prizes. The website should have functionalities for spinning the wheel, displaying prizes, and recording user winning records. Users should be able to spin the wheel, view the prize list, view their own winning records. Use light gray as the default background and dark red for component styling.

name: Realm Conquest
initial_requirements: I need a game where I can grow a fantasy civilization and compete against other players through strategic decisions.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I expect to choose my race at the start of the game as a one-time initial setup decision for my civilization.
I expect to select my race from a predefined list rather than creating a custom race.
I assume that Humans, Dragonborns, Elves, and Dwarfs form the complete set of playable races for the initial version of the game.
I expect each race to have distinct gameplay-relevant attributes that meaningfully affect my strategic decisions.
I expect resource management to revolve around a finite set of core resources, specifically gold, iron, wood, and wheat.
I assume that all major in-game actions such as upgrades, unit training, and battles will consume or depend on the core resources I manage.
I expect that resources will be persistent over time and accumulate or deplete rather than being reset every session.
I expect to be able to adjust my resource levels indirectly through game actions like production, collection, or trade rather than editing numeric values directly.
I assume that upgrading my city, workers, and soldiers is the primary way to progress my civilization’s strength and efficiency.
I expect upgrades for city, workers, and soldiers to be structured in multiple levels or tiers rather than as a single one-time improvement.
I expect to initiate upgrades through dedicated interface elements such as buttons or actions rather than automated upgrades.
I assume that battles are a recurring activity that significantly influences my civilization’s growth and competitive standing.
I expect battles to be triggered by my explicit actions rather than occurring automatically without my input.
I expect to compete against multiple other players rather than only a single opponent or purely AI-controlled civilizations.
I assume that the base page will serve as the default landing view after login or game entry, showing an overview of my city and resources.
I expect the base page to summarize key status information such as current resources, city level, and army strength in one place.
I expect to navigate between base, ranking, store, train, workers, upgrades, bank, messages, and reports pages via a consistent menu or navigation bar.
I assume that each named page (base, ranking, store, train, workers, upgrades, bank, messages, reports) represents a distinct functional area rather than overlapping pages with the same content.
I expect the ranking page to display my relative position among other players, not just isolated statistics.
I assume that the store page allows spending in-game resources or currency on items or advantages relevant to my civilization.
I expect the train page to focus specifically on creating or improving military units rather than general worker or city management.
I assume that the workers page will focus on assigning or improving workers’ roles related to resource production or construction.
I expect the upgrades page to present a list or tree of available improvements for my city, workers, and soldiers.
I assume that the bank page will manage in-game financial operations such as storing, converting, or possibly earning interest on resources or currency.
I expect the messages page to contain communications specifically related to game events, other players, or system notifications.
I assume that the reports page will provide historical or detailed summaries of completed actions such as battles, transactions, or production logs.
I expect the seashell background to be consistently visible across all main game pages rather than changing per page.
I expect the seashell background to be primarily decorative and not interfere with readability of text and interface elements.
I assume that crimson will be applied consistently to major content blocks such as panels or cards to establish a recognizable color scheme.
I expect text and icons within crimson content blocks to remain clearly legible with appropriate contrasting colors.
I expect all gameplay actions, including battles, resource management, and upgrades, to be performed through a browser-based interface without requiring client installation.
I assume that my civilization’s state, including race choice, resources, upgrades, and standings, will persist between sessions so I can continue long-term progression.

URL: As a user, I want to choose a race so that I can play the strategy browser game as my preferred faction.
As a user, I want to choose from Humans as a race so that I can benefit from their unique attributes.
As a user, I want to choose from Dragonborns as a race so that I can benefit from their unique attributes.
As a user, I want to choose from Elves as a race so that I can benefit from their unique attributes.
As a user, I want to choose from Dwarfs as a race so that I can benefit from their unique attributes.
As a user, I want to manage gold so that I can use it as a resource in the game.
As a user, I want to manage iron so that I can use it as a resource in the game.
As a user, I want to manage wood so that I can use it as a resource in the game.
As a user, I want to manage wheat so that I can use it as a resource in the game.
As a user, I want to upgrade my city so that I can improve my overall capabilities.
As a user, I want to upgrade my workers so that I can enhance their effectiveness.
As a user, I want to upgrade my soldiers so that I can strengthen my army.
As a user, I want to battle so that I can engage in combat within the strategy game.
As a user, I want to access a base page so that I can view and manage my main city and resources.
As a user, I want to access a ranking page so that I can see how I compare to other players.
As a user, I want to access a store page so that I can perform game-related purchases.
As a user, I want to access a train page so that I can train units or improve my forces.
As a user, I want to access a workers page so that I can manage my workers.
As a user, I want to access an upgrades page so that I can manage available upgrades.
As a user, I want to access a bank page so that I can interact with in-game banking features.
As a user, I want to access a messages page so that I can view in-game communications.
As a user, I want to access a reports page so that I can review game-related reports.
As a user, I want the site to use a seashell background so that the visual design matches the specified theme.
As a user, I want content blocks to use crimson so that the game interface follows the required color scheme.
instruction: Please implement a text-based strategy browser game where players can choose a race, manage resources, upgrade, and battle. The game should have multiple pages, including the base page, ranking page, store, train page, workers page, upgrades page, bank page, messages page, and reports page. Players can choose from four races: Humans, Dragonborns, Elves, and Dwarfs, each with unique attributes. Players can manage resources, including gold, iron, wood, and wheat, and can upgrade their city, workers, and soldiers. Design the site using seashell as the background and crimson for content blocks.

name: Baseball Simulation Manager
initial_requirements: I need a system that lets me manage baseball teams and simulate their games over time.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I expect to identify teams and players by recognizable names rather than by system-generated codes.
I want to specify which teams participate in a simulation by selecting from my managed teams.
I expect to select individual players for roster and lineup decisions from a list of players associated with my teams.
I want the system to support managing more than one baseball team at the same time.
I expect the simulation to cover multiple games over a season-like time span, not just single one-off games.
I want player statistics to be accumulated and retained across multiple simulated games.
I expect financial information to be tracked over time rather than only for individual games.
I want player statistics to include both basic stats and more detailed metrics that are meaningful for baseball performance analysis.
I expect game results to include both the final score and key summary details such as team and player performance highlights.
I expect team finances to include both income and expenses relevant to running a baseball team.
I want team strategy settings to include multiple tactical options that can plausibly affect simulated game outcomes.
I expect lineup management to let me specify both starting players and at least some bench or substitute players.
I want to initiate simulations on demand rather than having games run automatically without my input.
I expect to be able to change team strategies and lineups between games without having to recreate the team.
I want to update team rosters and finances through direct manipulation of data within the system rather than through external tools.
I expect the system to immediately reflect my roster, strategy, and lineup changes in subsequent simulations.
I want to navigate between team management, simulations, statistics, and results using consistent on-screen controls.
I expect the live game simulations to present events in a sequence that mimics the flow of an actual baseball game.
I want detailed player statistics to be displayed in a structured tabular or comparable format that makes comparison easy.
I expect game results to be viewable in a summary view with the option to see more detailed breakdowns.
I want the floral white background color to be applied consistently across all main pages of the website.
I expect interactive elements such as buttons, links, and controls to consistently use dark goldenrod so they are visually distinguishable.
I want the chosen color scheme to provide enough contrast between floral white backgrounds and dark goldenrod elements for comfortable viewing.

URL: As a user, I want to simulate baseball games so that I can experience live game simulations.
As a user, I want to manage baseball teams so that I can control team composition and operations.
As a user, I want to track player statistics so that I can monitor player performance over time.
As a user, I want to view detailed player statistics so that I can analyze individual player performance.
As a user, I want to manage team rosters so that I can decide which players are on my team.
As a user, I want to manage team finances so that I can oversee the financial aspects of my team.
As a user, I want to view game results so that I can see the outcome of my simulated games.
As a user, I want to adjust team strategies based on my management decisions so that I can influence how my team plays.
As a user, I want to adjust team lineups based on my management decisions so that I can control which players participate in games.
As a user, I want the layout background to use floral white so that the website appearance matches the specified design.
As a user, I want interactive elements to use dark goldenrod so that the interactive parts of the website follow the specified color scheme.
instruction: Please implement a baseball simulation website for simulating baseball games and managing baseball teams. The website should have functionalities for player statistics tracking, team management, and live game simulation. Users should be able to view detailed player statistics, manage team rosters and finances, simulate games, and view the results. Users should also be able to adjust team strategies and lineups based on their management decisions. Apply floral white for the layout background and dark goldenrod for interactive elements.

name: 2048 Game Website
initial_requirements: I need a website where I can play the 2048 puzzle game online.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I assume I will use my keyboard arrow keys or equivalent directional controls on the website to move tiles on the board.
I expect the game board to be clearly identifiable as the main interactive area where all moves and merges occur.
I expect the website to provide only the classic 2048 game mode rather than multiple game variants.
I assume that each new game starts with an empty or nearly empty board and no carry-over from previous games.
I expect that reviving after game over will continue from the same board state that existed at the moment the game ended.
I assume the game will use the standard 4x4 grid layout associated with 2048.
I expect new tiles to appear automatically after each valid move in accordance with typical 2048 rules.
I assume tile values will follow the usual powers-of-two progression used in 2048.
I expect the game to maintain and display a score that reflects the merges I have made.
I expect my moves to be applied immediately when I press a directional control, without additional confirmation steps.
I assume the game will prevent me from making moves that do not change the board state.
I expect starting a new game to be available at any time during play without needing to finish the current game.
I assume I will be clearly prompted with an option to revive when the game is detected as over.
I expect the game board and tiles to be visually distinct from the linen background so they are easy to see.
I assume that using maroon for all component colors still preserves sufficient contrast between different UI elements such as tiles, buttons, and text.
I expect the win condition of achieving the 2048 tile to be visually indicated, for example through a message or highlight.
I assume the game-over state will be clearly indicated with an overlay or message distinct from the normal playing view.

URL: As a user, I want to start a new game so that I can begin playing 2048.
As a user, I want to move tiles up so that I can control the game board.
As a user, I want to move tiles down so that I can control the game board.
As a user, I want to move tiles left so that I can control the game board.
As a user, I want to move tiles right so that I can control the game board.
As a user, I want identical tiles to merge so that I can increase my tile values.
As a user, I want to win the game by achieving the 2048 result so that I can complete the game objective.
As a user, I want the game to detect when it is over so that I know I cannot make more moves.
As a user, I want to choose to revive when the game is over so that I can continue playing.
As a user, I want the website background to be linen so that the game has the specified visual style.
As a user, I want all component colors to be maroon so that the interface follows a consistent color scheme.
instruction: Please implement a 2048 game website for users to play the 2048 game. The website should have functionalities for starting a new game, moving tiles, merging tiles, game over, and reviving. Users should be able to start a new game, move tiles up, down, left, or right, merge identical tiles, and win the game by achieving the 2048 result. If the game is over, users can choose to revive and continue playing. Choose linen for the background; set all component colors to maroon.

name: Credit Repair Lead Hub
initial_requirements: I need a website that helps attract and capture potential clients interested in credit repair services.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I assume that the form will collect standard personal contact fields such as name, email address, and phone number so that I can be reached easily.
I expect to indicate my credit status using predefined options or simple inputs (e.g., ranges or categories) rather than needing to provide detailed financial reports.
I assume the website will focus exclusively on credit repair–related information and actions rather than offering broader financial products or services.
I expect the credit score inquiry function to cover at least the major consumer credit scoring model that I am familiar with so that the result is meaningful to me.
I want the website to describe the specific types of credit repair services offered, such as dispute handling and guidance, rather than only giving a generic description.
I expect explanations of credit repair concepts to be written in non-technical language that a person without financial expertise can understand.
I want the website to explain what information will be done with my credit status and contact details so that I know why they are being requested.
I expect the credit score inquiry result to include at least a numeric score value rather than only a qualitative label.
I prefer that the lead capture form be accessible directly from the website pages I am browsing without requiring me to log in or create an account.
I expect the lead capture form to provide clear validation messages if I miss or incorrectly fill any required fields before submission.
I want to receive an on-screen confirmation that my lead information has been successfully submitted so that I know my request went through.
I expect the credit score inquiry function to be initiated from within the website interface rather than redirecting me to an unrelated external site without warning.
I assume that the old lace background color will be applied consistently across all main content pages so that the browsing experience feels cohesive.
I expect rosy brown UI elements such as buttons, form fields, and navigation controls to be visually distinct from the old lace background for easy recognition.
I want the text content to remain easily readable against the old lace background and rosy brown UI elements through appropriate font color and contrast choices.
I assume the website layout will be simple and uncluttered so that the information about services and the lead form are easy to find.

URL: As a user, I want to browse the website so that I can explore the credit repair company’s offerings.
As a user, I want to learn about credit repair services so that I can understand how they can help improve my credit.
As a user, I want to fill out a form with my personal information so that I can provide my contact details as a potential lead.
As a user, I want to input my credit status in the form so that the company can understand my current credit situation.
As a user, I want to submit my lead information through the form so that the credit repair company can follow up with me.
As a user, I want to use a credit score inquiry function so that I can check my credit score on the website.
As a user, I want the website body background to use an old lace color so that the overall appearance is visually consistent with the design.
As a user, I want the UI elements to use a rosy brown color so that the website interface matches the specified style.
instruction: Please implement a website for a credit repair company to generate leads. The website should have a form-filling function, allowing users to input personal information and credit status. The website should also have a credit score inquiry function and an introduction to credit repair services. Users can browse the website, learn about credit repair services, and fill out the form to submit lead information. Set old lace as the body background and use rosy brown for the UI.

name: Clinical Office Info Site
initial_requirements: I need a website that lets people easily learn about my clinical office and how to reach us.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I assume visitors will identify relevant information about the clinical office primarily by choosing from clearly labeled top-level pages such as Home, About, Services, and Contact.
I want all information needed to learn about the clinical office and how to reach us to be covered within a small set of core pages rather than many specialized sections.
I expect that browsing the site should be sufficient for users to understand who we are, what we offer, and how to contact us without needing external resources.
I want the homepage to summarize the most important information about the clinical office rather than requiring users to open multiple pages to understand the basics.
I expect the about page to focus on descriptive information about the clinical office such as background, mission, and team rather than operational or technical details.
I want the services page to present a clear list or grouping of clinical services rather than mixing this information into general office descriptions.
I assume the contact page will provide multiple contact options such as phone, email, and a contact form rather than a single method only.
I want the website content to focus on practical information that helps potential patients decide whether the clinical office is suitable for them.
I want users to be able to initiate contact with the office directly from the website without having to copy contact details into another application manually.
I prefer that users can reach any key page of the site with at most one or two clicks from wherever they currently are.
I want the navigation menu to be consistently available on all pages so users do not have to go back to the homepage to move around the site.
I expect the navigation menu to use straightforward, non-technical labels that typical patients or visitors can understand immediately.
I want every page of the website to share the same light cyan background so that users perceive the site as a unified whole.
I consider a light cyan background appropriate for conveying a calm, clinical, and welcoming atmosphere for visitors.
I want primary interface elements such as headers, buttons, and navigation components to use cadet blue so they visually stand out against the background.
I expect the color choices of light cyan and cadet blue to be applied consistently across all pages instead of varying by section.
I prefer the visual design to be simple and clean rather than highly decorative so users can focus on the office information and contact options.
I assume text and interactive elements will be easy to read and distinguish against the light cyan background and cadet blue components.

URL: As a user, I want to access a homepage so that I can see an overview of the clinical office.
As a user, I want to view an about us page so that I can learn about the office's information.
As a user, I want to view a services page so that I can see the services provided by the office.
As a user, I want to view a contact us page so that I can find ways to contact the office.
As a user, I want to browse the website so that I can learn about the office's information.
As a user, I want to browse the website so that I can view the services provided.
As a user, I want to contact the office through the contact page so that I can get in touch with the clinical office.
As a user, I want to use a simple navigation menu so that I can quickly find the information I need.
As a user, I want all pages styled with a light cyan background so that the website has a consistent visual appearance.
As a user, I want components styled in cadet blue so that the website's elements have a coherent design.
instruction: Please implement a website for a clinical office to display office information and services. The website should have basic pages, including a homepage, about us, services, and contact us. Users should be able to browse the website, learn about the office's information, view the services provided, and contact the office through the contact page. The website should also have a simple navigation menu to help users quickly find the information they need. Style all pages with a light cyan background and cadet blue components.

name: Solar Company Showcase
initial_requirements: I need a website that helps people learn about my solar company and what it offers.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I assume the website will serve primarily as an informational site rather than an online store or transactional platform.
I want the company introduction to include who we are, what we do, and where we operate in a concise overview section.
I expect the company history to be organized in chronological order so users can follow our development over time.
I want the mission content to be a clearly stated, focused description rather than scattered across multiple pages.
I expect the company values to be listed as distinct items so users can easily recognize each principle.
I want the product showcase to cover all major solar product categories that we currently offer, not just a few examples.
I expect the product showcase to present each product with at least a title, brief description, and an image or visual representation.
I want detailed product information to include key technical specifications such as capacity, efficiency, and intended use.
I assume each product in the showcase will have an associated detail view or section where extended information is available.
I want the news updates section to cover multiple posts rather than a single announcement so users can see ongoing activity.
I expect each news update to include at least a title, publication date, and short description or summary.
I want users to be able to access the contact page directly from the main navigation so it is easy to find.
I assume the contact page will indicate which fields are required so users know what they must provide.
I want users to submit their contact details and message through a form on the contact page rather than using only a plain email link.
I expect the contact page to use clearly labeled input fields for name, email, and message so users understand what to enter.
I want the contact form to provide a confirmation or success indication after the user submits their message.
I assume the lemon chiffon background color will be applied consistently across all pages of the site.
I want the chocolate color to be used for key interface components such as headers, navigation elements, or content blocks to create a coherent theme.
I expect the color scheme using lemon chiffon and chocolate to maintain sufficient contrast so content remains clearly readable.
I want users to navigate between introduction, history, mission, values, products, news, and contact via a simple, top-level menu.

URL: As a user, I want to view the company introduction so that I can understand basic information about the solar company.
As a user, I want to browse the company's history so that I can learn about how the company has developed over time.
As a user, I want to browse the company's mission so that I can understand the goals and purpose of the company.
As a user, I want to browse the company's values so that I can understand the principles the company stands for.
As a user, I want to view a product showcase so that I can see the solar products the company offers.
As a user, I want to view detailed product information so that I can understand the specifications and features of each product.
As a user, I want to view news updates so that I can learn about the company's latest news and events.
As a user, I want to use a contact page to reach the company so that I can communicate with them.
As a user, I want to provide my name on the contact page so that the company knows who is contacting them.
As a user, I want to provide my email on the contact page so that the company can reply to me.
As a user, I want to provide a message on the contact page so that I can describe my inquiry or feedback.
As a user, I want the website background layer to use lemon chiffon so that the visual appearance matches the specified style.
As a user, I want the component layer to use chocolate so that the interface elements follow the specified color scheme.
instruction: Please implement a website for a solar company to display company information and products. The website should have functionalities for company introduction, product showcase, news updates, and contact us. Users should be able to browse the company's history, mission, and values, view detailed product information, learn about the company's latest news and events, and contact the company through the contact page with name, email and message. Use lemon chiffon in the background layer and chocolate for the component layer.

name: Fundraiser Day Promo Site
initial_requirements: I need a website that helps people learn about and get interested in our Fundraiser Day event.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I assume that all essential information about Fundraiser Day can be effectively presented within a single one-page website rather than multiple separate pages.
I expect the introduction to clearly explain the purpose, goals, and basic structure of the Fundraiser Day event without requiring additional pages.
I expect fundraiser testimonials to focus on personal experiences and outcomes related to Fundraiser Day rather than general feedback about the organization.
I expect offers related to Fundraiser Day to be summarized in a way that highlights the most relevant details for potential participants, such as what is included and why it is attractive.
I assume that the company information will provide enough background to build trust and credibility without overwhelming users with excessive corporate details.
I assume that users will not need to enter any data or make complex selections to access the introduction, testimonials, offers, or company information.
I prefer that users can discover all major sections of the page by scrolling rather than having to navigate through a complex menu structure.
I prefer that the offers carousel advances automatically so users can passively discover multiple offers without having to click or tap.
I assume users can still manually interact with the offers carousel, such as pausing or moving between offers, if they choose to.
I assume that displaying a curated subset of testimonials is sufficient, rather than showing every available testimonial about Fundraiser Day.
I assume that it is sufficient to present a limited number of main offers in the carousel instead of an exhaustive list of all possible offers.
I expect the page layout to visually distinguish the introduction, testimonials, offers, and company information as separate sections within the single page.
I assume that the cornsilk background color will be applied consistently across the whole page rather than varying between sections.
I assume that the peru color for controls will be applied uniformly to all interactive elements such as buttons, carousel controls, and links.
I expect the offers carousel to be visually prominent enough that users can immediately notice and recognize it as an interactive element.
I expect the testimonials section to be formatted in a way that clearly separates individual testimonials, making them easy to read and scan.
I expect the company information section to be placed in a consistent location on the page where users intuitively look for background or 'about' information.
I prefer users to be able to quickly scroll back and forth between sections without losing context or needing to reload any part of the page.
I assume that users will primarily access the site as visitors seeking information, not as logged-in users with personalized content.
I expect all information presented—introduction, offers, testimonials, and company background—to be directly tied to the Fundraiser Day event and not to unrelated activities.

URL: As a user, I want to view an introduction to the Fundraiser Day event so that I can understand what the event is about.
As a user, I want to view fundraiser testimonials so that I can see feedback and experiences from other fundraisers.
As a user, I want to view offer information so that I can learn about the offers related to Fundraiser Day.
As a user, I want to view company information so that I can learn more about the organization behind Fundraiser Day.
As a user, I want to browse the one-page website so that I can easily learn more about the Fundraiser Day event in one place.
As a user, I want to see offers displayed in an automatically moving carousel so that I can conveniently view multiple offers without manual interaction.
As a user, I want to view a dedicated section for fundraiser testimonials so that I can easily find and read them.
As a user, I want to view a dedicated section for company information so that I can easily locate background details about the company.
As a user, I want the website to use cornsilk as the main background so that the overall page appearance is consistent with the event design.
As a user, I want the website controls to use peru as their color so that interactive elements have a distinct and consistent style.
instruction: Please create a one-page website for promoting Fundraiser Day, including introduction to the event, fundraiser testimonials, offer information, and company information. The website should have functionalities such as an automatically moving carousel for displaying offers, a section for displaying fundraiser testimonials, and a section for displaying company information. Users should be able to browse the website to learn more about the Fundraiser Day event. Establish cornsilk as the main background and peru for the controls.

name: Home Cleaning Service Portal
initial_requirements: I need a system that helps me find and arrange professional house cleaning services.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I expect to specify my cleaning needs primarily by providing my house location and preferred date and time when arranging a service.
I expect to identify the type of cleaning service I want by selecting from predefined service options rather than describing everything in free text.
I expect to provide my contact details when booking or submitting inquiries so that the service provider can respond to me.
I expect the system to focus only on professional house cleaning and not include other unrelated household services.
I expect the system to support both one‑time and scheduled cleaning appointments within the same booking experience.
I expect the booking, inquiry, and contact features to be available to me without requiring me to visit or call a physical office first.
I expect the website to provide an overview of the company and its house cleaning services before I start a booking.
I expect the service details to describe what is included and excluded in each type of cleaning service in plain language.
I expect the website to show the time slots or availability windows for booking so I can choose when the cleaners will come.
I expect the booking function to capture essential information about my property, such as size or number of rooms, to define the service scope.
I expect the service status information to clearly indicate whether my request is submitted, confirmed, in progress, or completed.
