I expect the contact and customer service sections to display the actual phone number and email address I should use.
I expect to initiate and complete the entire booking process online without needing to switch to a different channel.
I expect the service inquiry functionality to allow me to type my own questions in a free‑text form field.
I expect to be able to use either online forms, phone calls, or email depending on what is most convenient for me at the time.
I expect contacting customer service by phone or email to be accessible from the same website where I book services.
I expect to be able to check the status of my cleaning service by referring to some identifier, such as a booking reference or my contact information.
I expect the entire website to use an azure mist background consistently across pages.
I expect the interactive components, such as buttons and navigation elements, to use dark slate blue so that they stand out against the background.
I expect the chosen colors to be used in a consistent way so that the visual style feels uniform throughout the site.
I expect the layout of service information, booking forms, and contact options to be organized in a way that is easy to scan and understand.

URL: As a user, I want to browse the website so that I can learn about the house cleaning service.
As a user, I want to understand the details of the cleaning services so that I know what services are offered.
As a user, I want to book cleaning services so that I can schedule a cleaning appointment.
As a user, I want to use a booking services functionality so that I can submit my cleaning service request online.
As a user, I want to use a service inquiry functionality so that I can ask questions about cleaning services.
As a user, I want to use a contact us functionality so that I can reach out to the service provider.
As a user, I want to check service status so that I can know the progress of my cleaning service.
As a user, I want to contact customer service staff by phone number so that I can speak directly with support.
As a user, I want to contact customer service staff by email address so that I can communicate with support in writing.
As a user, I want the website background set to azure mist so that the overall appearance is visually consistent.
As a user, I want components to apply dark slate blue so that the interface has a clear and consistent style.
instruction: Please implement a house cleaning service website that provides cleaning services. The website should have functionalities for booking services, service inquiry, and contact us. Users should be able to browse the website, understand the details of the cleaning services, book cleaning services, check service status, and contact customer service staff by phone number and email address. Set the background to azure mist, and apply dark slate blue to components.

name: Software Solutions Showcase
initial_requirements: I need a website that helps prospective customers easily understand and explore my software solutions and staffing services.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I only need the website to support prospective customers as the primary audience rather than multiple distinct user roles.

I want the website to focus exclusively on presenting information about my software solutions and staffing services without offering transactional features such as online purchasing or account management.
I want users to identify specific software solutions primarily by their product names or categories when searching or browsing.
I expect users to search for information using simple keyword-based queries rather than complex filters or advanced search syntax.
I want the website to include distinct sections for software solutions, staffing services, industry content, and customer stories rather than mixing all information on a single page.
I want an overview or introduction of the company that clearly summarizes both software solutions and staffing services together before users drill down into details.
I want each product description to include essential details such as what the solution does, who it is for, and the main benefits from a business perspective.
I want staffing service descriptions to highlight the types of roles, engagement models, and value proposition instead of technical implementation details.
I want industry news and trend articles to relate directly to the domains my software solutions and staffing services target, rather than covering general technology news.
I want customer success stories to describe the customer’s situation, the solution or service provided, and the outcomes achieved in a narrative form.
I prefer that all written content use non-technical language that business-oriented readers can understand without specialized expertise.
I want articles and news items to link back to relevant products or services where applicable so that users can easily continue exploring related offerings.
I want users to be able to move between high-level overviews and detailed descriptions with minimal clicks, using clear navigation paths.
I expect users to rely on both navigation menus and the search feature when exploring the website rather than only one or the other.
I want the search results to clearly distinguish between content types such as products, services, news, and success stories so users know what they are opening.
I want users to be able to initiate contact from multiple points in their journey, such as from product pages, service pages, and general contact sections.
I prefer that contacting the website owner be possible through a straightforward form or clearly visible contact details without requiring user registration.
I want the website’s overall visual style to be simple and consistent so that the misty rose backgrounds and firebrick components feel cohesive rather than decorative distractions.
I want text content to be laid out in short sections, headings, and bullet points where appropriate so that information can be scanned quickly.
I want the use of misty rose backgrounds to apply across all pages including home, product, service, news, and contact sections for visual consistency.
I want firebrick to be used consistently for key interface elements such as buttons, links, and navigation items to create a recognizable brand accent color.
I prefer that customer success stories and news articles include visual separators or highlights so that they stand out from general descriptive text.
I want the website to provide enough information for prospective customers to make an informed decision to contact us, rather than trying to fully replace direct sales conversations.
I want the tone of all content to feel professional yet approachable so that prospects are comfortable reaching out for more information.

URL: As a user, I want to browse the website so that I can explore the available software solutions information.
As a user, I want to view content that introduces the software solutions and staffing business so that I can understand what the company offers.
As a user, I want to read product descriptions so that I can learn about specific software solutions.
As a user, I want to read service descriptions so that I can understand the staffing and related services provided.
As a user, I want to read about industry news and trends so that I can stay informed about the market context.
As a user, I want to read customer cases and success stories so that I can see how the solutions have worked for other customers.
As a user, I want the website content to be easy to understand so that I can quickly grasp the information provided.
As a user, I want the website content to be engaging so that it holds my attention.
As a user, I want to search for relevant information so that I can quickly find topics that interest me.
As a user, I want to search for product descriptions so that I can locate details about specific offerings.
As a user, I want to read articles and news so that I can deepen my understanding of the software solutions and industry.
As a user, I want to contact the website owner for more information so that I can ask questions or request further details.
As a user, I want the website backgrounds configured with misty rose so that the visual appearance is consistent.
As a user, I want all components configured with firebrick so that the site’s interface elements share a unified style.
instruction: Please create a software solutions website to provide information to prospective customers. The website should have content that introduces software solutions and staffing business, including product and service descriptions, industry news and trends, customer cases and success stories, etc. The website should be able to attract the attention of small to medium-sized businesses, and the content should be easy to understand and engaging. Users should be able to browse the website, search for relevant information or product descriptions, read articles and news, and contact the website owner for more information. Configure all backgrounds with misty rose and all components with firebrick.

name: Telecom Service Portal
initial_requirements: I need a system that lets me explore my phone services and get help with my account.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I expect the system to recognize me as an existing customer using a unique identifier such as my login credentials or account number before allowing access to my account information.
I expect to identify specific service plans by recognizable labels such as plan names or brief descriptors when browsing or viewing details.
I want the system to cover all phone service plans that are currently available to me as a customer, not just a limited subset.
I expect the account management functions to apply to all key personal details stored in my account profile, such as contact information and billing-related data.
I want each service plan detail page to clearly list included features, limitations, and any usage conditions so I can fully understand the plan.
I expect the list of service plans to show at least the plan name, a short description, and a way to access more detailed information.
I expect my account information section to include my personal details such as name, address, contact information, and other core profile fields relevant to my phone services.
I want the customer support area to provide a way to describe my issue or question in my own words so that I can receive appropriate help.
I want to navigate from a general list of service plans to detailed information about a specific plan with a simple action such as clicking or tapping.
I expect to be able to modify my account details directly on the website without needing to contact customer service by phone.
I want the online customer support tool to be accessible from the same website where I browse plans and manage my account, without switching to a separate application.
I expect that changes I make to my account information are confirmed by the system so I know the updates have been applied.
I want the light goldenrod body background color to be applied consistently across all website pages related to my phone services and account.
I expect key interface elements such as main sections or primary components to be visually distinguished using the olive drab color.
I want the color scheme using light goldenrod and olive drab to be prominent enough that the design looks intentional and cohesive across the site.

I expect plan lists, account information, and support tools to be displayed in a clear layout that aligns with the specified color scheme rather than using additional unrelated colors for main components.

URL: As a user, I want to browse service plans so that I can see the available service plan options.
As a user, I want to view service plan details so that I can understand what each plan offers.
As a user, I want to use an online customer support tool so that I can get help when I need assistance.
As a user, I want to get help through the website so that my questions or issues can be resolved.
As a user, I want to manage my account information so that I can keep my account details up to date.
As a user, I want to access my personal details so that I can review the information associated with my account.
As a user, I want the website body background to use a light goldenrod color so that the overall page appearance is consistent with the design requirement.
As a user, I want the main components to use an olive drab color so that key parts of the interface follow the specified color scheme.
instruction: Please implement a website for a phone operator to display service plans and provide customer support. The website should have functionalities for displaying service plan details and an online customer support tool. Users should be able browse service plans, get help, manage their account information, and access their personal details. Assign light goldenrod to body backgrounds and olive drab to main components.

name: All-In Bourbon Bar Showcase
initial_requirements: I need a website that lets people discover and engage with The All-In Bourbon Bar’s offerings.

Implicit Requirements.RequirementText: I assume that I will recognize and access the information I need through clearly labeled navigation items such as menus, events, promotions, membership, and reservations.
I expect to be able to specify reservation details such as date, time, and party size through straightforward form fields rather than free-form text.
I expect the website to cover both on-premise experiences and purchasable products or services that are relevant to The All-In Bourbon Bar.
I assume that all major offerings of The All-In Bourbon Bar, including the private poker room, menus, and events, will be discoverable from the main navigation.
I expect online reservations and purchases to be limited to offerings that The All-In Bourbon Bar is prepared to manage through the website, not every possible in-person service.
I expect the product and service information to include enough descriptive details for me to understand what The All-In Bourbon Bar offers without needing to call or visit first.
I want menus to show item names, basic descriptions, and pricing so that I can make informed choices about food and drinks.
I expect information about the membership-only private poker room to include who is eligible and how membership is obtained, not just a generic description.
I want event and promotion listings to include dates and times so that I can decide whether I can attend.
I expect online purchase options to clearly indicate what is being bought, such as gift cards, event tickets, or branded items, along with their prices.
I want the exclusivity of the private poker room to be emphasized through wording and imagery that conveys a premium, members-only experience.
I expect browsing to be primarily click-based navigation through pages and sections rather than relying on search or filters as the main entry point.
I want to complete reservations using a guided step-by-step flow so that I can review and confirm my details before submitting.
I expect the online purchase process to resemble a conventional e-commerce flow with an add-to-cart or direct checkout experience.
I expect the website to allow interaction using standard web controls like buttons, dropdowns, and calendars without requiring special plugins or tools.
I want peach puff container backgrounds to be applied consistently across all major content sections so that the visual structure of the site appears unified.
I expect indian red to be used for key interactive components such as buttons, highlights, and important interface elements to reinforce the brand’s visual identity.
I assume that the peach puff and indian red color scheme will be combined with neutral supporting colors so that text and content remain readable.
I expect menus, event listings, reservations, and purchase sections to share a consistent layout style so that the site feels cohesive.
I want the overall visual design to reflect the atmosphere of a bourbon bar and private poker room, using the specified colors to convey a warm and upscale feel.

URL: As a user, I want to browse the website so that I can explore The All-In Bourbon Bar’s products and services.
As a user, I want to view menus so that I can see the food and drink options available at The All-In Bourbon Bar.
As a user, I want to learn about the membership-only private poker room so that I can understand its features and exclusivity.
As a user, I want to view events and promotions so that I can stay informed about current and upcoming offerings.
As a user, I want to make online reservations so that I can secure a spot at The All-In Bourbon Bar in advance.
As a user, I want to make online purchases so that I can buy products or services from The All-In Bourbon Bar through the website.
As a user, I want the website’s container backgrounds to use peach puff so that the visual design is consistent with the specified style.
As a user, I want the website’s component visuals to use indian red so that the interface elements match the desired color scheme.
instruction: Please implement a website for The All-In Bourbon Bar to showcase its products and services. The website should have functionalities for displaying menus, introducing the membership-only private poker room, and showcasing events and promotions. Users should be able to browse the website, view menus, learn about the private poker room, view events and promotions, and make online reservations or purchases. Use peach puff for container backgrounds and indian red for component visuals.
